title: Man Utd goalkeeper David De Gea admits performances aren't acceptable as he says sorry to the fans
text:
David De Gea has admitted that Manchester United's performances so far this season has not been acceptable.

Teenager Matty Longstaff scored on his debut as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side fell to a torrid 1-0 defeat to Newcastle United meaning they haven't won in their last three Premier League games.

The result means that Manchester United have fallen to 12th position in the Premier League going into the international break with their next game coming up against heated rivals Liverpool.

Matty Longstaff's goal means that Manchester United now lie 12th in the Premier League

When asked about what his team could improve on, De Gea stated 'everything'.

He told Sky Sports: 'There's a lot of things to improve. They were the better team today.

'Like I said before, I don't know what to say. We've got to keep trying, keep fighting and keep improving.

'It’s a hard moment for us but we’re United, we’ve got to keep fighting'.

The result puts more pressure on United who are now 15 points behind league leaders Liverpool after eight games and just two above the relegation zone.

The club are also struggling to score goals having not found the net in their last two games.

David De Gea criticised his team for the manner in how they conceded their goal

De Gea said: 'It’s probably the most difficult time since I’ve been here. We can’t even score just one goal in two games.

'Sorry to the fans. We will keep fighting for sure, we will come back.

'I think we defend quite well. It’s true that they had good chances to score but we conceded the goal from our own corner so that cannot happen. It’s not acceptable – not just this game, the whole season.'
description: David De Gea has apologised to Manchester United supporters following their latest setback after a 1-0 defeat to Newcastle United. The result means United lie 12th in the league.
